comment: lots of extra credit. This whole semester is on quizlet to put it vaguely lol. search one thing and everything is there for you. NON STOP talk about elon musk lolll but you do make ur own extra credit history memes and he will tell you straight up your meme sucks. i was so hurt. but I still got them point hehe. very good prof tho. he cares frfr.

Professor Taylor's class was decent, Some of his lectures were interesting. There's a weekly discussion due almost every week, His exams are hard but he offers so much extra credit. I failed the first two exams and still passed the class with an A. You do need to do all the discussions and Extra credit though to get an A. Lots of extra credit!!!!

His class is very lecture heavy. Some of the information he shares seemed like an exaggeration of history and hard to believe because of his inflection. He wears his Ph.D. on his sleeve and makes it a point to tell his students that he is knowledgeable. He does discuss his own political view regularly throughout the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Taylor is awesome! He really is passionate about what he teachers and he made our class so enjoyable to take. Prof Taylor is super funny too! This semester was rough for me but Professor Taylor was super understanding and was willing to work with to help me succeed and do well. He really does care and I highly recommend you take him!

Basically the tests are your main grade, he gives 40 bonus pts for attendance, but he posts his lectures online so he makes it hard to attend. 
The test are multiple choice and short answer to prove your choice, if he doesn't like your short answer, you're basically screwed, but if you study, easy A.

Best US history professor! He is very clear about the class from day one. Lectures are boring some days but he is very passionate about the topic. Quizzes and discussion post (all very easy) almost every week. Test were difficult at times but nothing impossible as long as you attend class. GIVES LOTS OF EXTRA CREDIT! Overall very solid professor!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Taylor was a great guy but I can't lie, the test were really difficult to me. I've never had to study for a test before until this class and I even failed a test. Luckily, he offers an abundance of extra credit. My three test grades were all 80% and lower and I still passed with an A. Make sure to do the discussions and extra credit

Discussion post and quiz due almost every week. 3 tests, no final, I failed all 3 tho. Thanks to discussion posts, quizzes, and extra credit, I was able to get an A. Lectures sometimes went off topic, but you can tell the professor is very passionate about the subject. Very understanding as long as you talk to him and send an email. Very kind

SO MUCH EXTRA CREDIT! Got an A because of it. His lectures are engaging and gives extra credit just for attending. 5 out of 9 quizzes count. 3 tests are tough but just use the study guides he gives you. Discussions are always 3 questions but not hard to get through. Always available if you need anything. Highly recommend!

Honestly not a big history fan but Professor Taylor made this class very enjoyable. 3 exams which are pretty tough but he gives lots of extra credit to make up for it. Weekly to biweekly quizzes and discussions. Quizzes are 10 questions and answers can be found on quizlet and discussions are 3 questions and answers easily found in provided readings

The one thing I did not like about this class is the discussion posts. You have to read sometimes a 5 page article to answer the discussion post. His test are weird, you have to explain why you chose that answer. He has 9 quizzes and he drops the 5 lowest. He gives out a lot of extra credit.

I am glad i took him! He gives great lectures and is very knowledgeable about the course. He gives extra credit out so much! Im pretty sure if you only completed the extra credit you would still pass the class. However, his test are somewhat difficult and you have to explain why you chose the answer you did even though it was an obvious choice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: His tests are set up kind of weird, you have to explain your answers. The textbook is free, but you don't really need it everything is based on his lectures. There's usually one or two weekly assignment(s). You will also get lots of extra credit just by showing up to his class, with other extra credit opportunities. 10/10 would take him again.

PLEASE TAKE PROF TAYLOR!!! Best lectures ever, very very knowledgable about history, approachable, discussion posts pretty much weekly, 3 tests total, frequent quizzes (open note), and SO many extra credit opportunities. Quizzes are tough, but he drops 5 lowest scores. Tests require a lot of studying. Provides study guides and time lines for you.

Taylor gives extra credit like its candy. Literally impossible to fail if you put in the effort. He's very kind and very funny. We can get a little off topic sometimes in the sense that he goes off on tangents about deeper, insignificant stories, but don't get me wrong, they are interesting.

Dr. Taylor was so awesome. He gives so many opportunities for you to get an A with extra credit, and his quizzes are not that difficult either. The discussion posts are related to the material, but not from the textbook itself. The tests were a little weird, and you are graded not only by correct answer, but also an explanation, but was a cool prof
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This professor gives out extra credit for showing up for class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This is not any easy A, but with extra credit its possible.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: His extra credit gave me that A I need for this class!!

Love this teacher. His test were extremely hard. 15 multiple choice and you had to write 2-3 sentences each one why you think your answer is right. Do not skip a single day because he gives a ton of bonus points for a easy A!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's one of best history professors that I ever had !!
Class was easy, clear grading criteria and easy to follow along.

9 quizzes (4 are dropped), 10 discussion posts, 3 exams. Each exam is 15 multiple choice questions & 5 timeline questions with each question requiring a 2-3 written response as to why you chose that answer (total 20 questions, 20 responses). I averaged with a 70 on each test, however there are tons of options for extra credit to maintain an A.

He is fine, he is not the best, but I am a little mad because he made this class harder than it really is supposed to be. The grade has 3 tests and IT IS SO EASY to lose points on the test, if u miss one question that's most likely a B and these tests weigh 60% of your total grade. He provides extra credit which is the only thing that kept me an A
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Love this teacher. His test were extremely hard. 15 multiple choice and you had to write 2-3 sentences each one why you think your answer is right. then 5 matching. I never got above a 75 on a test but he gave 100+ bonus points, 40 for not skipping a single day. Little bit of effort and you will pass no doubt.

Prof Taylor is INCREDIBLE! Ive never liked history at all, but i thoroughly enjoyed his lectures! He is SO knowledgeable and doesnt just read off a powerpoint. His tests are hard because he does want explanations to answers, but he gives more than a whole letter grade in extra credit (100+ points) which MORE than makes up for it. TAKE HIS CLASS!

Professor Taylor was an amazing teacher. He gave MANY opportunities for extra credit! Im not the best test taker and not too great at history either, but even with a C average on the tests, I was able to make an easy A in the class. His lectures were really helpful and you get a ton of extra credit just for going to class everyday.

Professor Taylor is a good teacher and knows a lot about history. The tests are weird and nothing like the study guides at all. Takes the top 5 quizzes, 10 discussion boards (just write a lot). He gives a ton of extra credit to the point where it can change your letter grade. I don't like history at all, so the extra credit helped. I recommend him

20 EC points for 1 missed day, 40 for none. Also 40 EC points for surveys and memes. Keeps 5 highest quiz scores that have a bonus question. Decently easy discussion posts. Tests are not that bad if you study enough. Extra credit short answer on each test. Doesn't like technology use in class. Good about responding to messages. Caring professor.

SO MUCH EXTRA CREDIT. there are 3 exams, theyre mult choice but you have to defend your answers. there is also a timeline on each test. 40 EC points if you dont miss a class and 20 if you miss 1. Also gives EC throughout the semester so you should not fail. theres 10 discussions and 9 quizzes, but 4 quizzes are dropped. TAKE HIM!!!!!!!

40 points extra credit if you show up to every class, 20 points if you miss 1 class, no extra credit if you miss more than 1. Tests are weird; 15 multiple choice but you have to explain your answer in a short paragraph. makes the class feel like a graduate course so it is harder than it should be. Do not take

His tests are 15 questions mc and defending your answer. And a small time line. His whole class is point based so do ALL the extra credit you can. Dont turn in discussions late and if you go to every class you get extra points. His tests are very difficult in my opinion but Im not good at his and dont like it

Prof Taylor rocks! He gives so many extra credit opportunities. Attendance isn't mandatory but you can get extra credit for it. He makes lectures fun and interesting, and I do not like history at all. Provides study guide for tests. TAKE HIM!!! :)

Professor Taylor's class kept me both very busy and very entertained. He is a great lecturer who cares DEEPLY about his material and this tends to rub off on students. His tests can be tough but he structures them in ways that help his students succeed and offers a lot of extra credit opportunities. His lectures are long but he does include videos.

Professor Taylor is very knowledgeable in the history of the U.S. before 1877, his classes are interesting and informative. He does allow for extra credit, including earning points for attendance. He brings the history of the U.S. to life in this class.

He's a good professor and only gives lectures. He uses a point system which gives a decent amount of extra credit which is worth like 5% extra, definitely do it it's not hard and maybe takes 5 minutes. He won't bump you, but he's nice and knows his stuff. This might be the class for you if you dislike history because of the EX credit.

Professor Taylor is such a great professor! His lectures are actually interesting and he really cares about this subject. He makes it pretty clear what is on the tests and the quizzes are also easy. There's usually a discussion every week but he's not a hard grader at all! Such a good class, if you can take him DO IT!!!

Best history teacher I've ever had. Not enough space to do him justice. Class is enjoyable, he's smart, helpful (quick to respond), and funny. Extra credit opportunities are common. His quizzes are easy, discussions do-able, and even the short research paper isn't too much to do. His tests are challenging but very passable. Study! Def recommended!

Tests come from the lecture. Either a 5 page paper or 10 discussion posts (depends on class size), 10 quizzes (lowest 5 dropped), and 3 exams (not cumulative), 3rd exam is the "final". Puts all lectures and power points online. If you don't miss a class, you get 20 points added onto your final grade. Lectures are interesting, great prof. take him!

He is very passionate about what he is teaching. He speaks from the lectures like he was there and gets you to listen to him. Attendance isn't mandatory but if i were you I wouldn't skip the class. There are discussion post throughout the semester which are easy and online quizzes. Tests are hard if you don't go to class though.

Professor Taylor is awesome! He does not have office hours, however he is quick to respond to emails. There are 9 quizzes and he drops your lowest 4. 3 non-cumulative tests, these are tedious but if you do his study guides, you will. be okay! He is very passionate about the subject and gets you excited for the stories you learn.

Very cool guy. He's really into wanting you to know about U.S. History. His tests are different to where you have to select an answer and "defend" it (Explain why you chose your answer). He does give extra credit assignments. Overall he was a good professor.

Professor Taylor is awesome! Hecares about the subject and wants you to succeed. He gives many extra credit opportunities, lectures are long but hell add in videos to make them easier, and he gives grades back quickly.

No clear rubrics for assignments. Plenty of extra credit opportunities, including bonus points for really good discussion posts. Theoretically you don't have to attend to pass, but there is extra credit for perfect attendance. No rubrics. His use of videos can be good but can also be droning and exhausting. Oh yeah, and did I say no clear rubrics?

easy a class. we didn't use the textbook. he also gives out sooo much extra credit. if you do the study guides and study then you will pass. also attendance is not mandatory. the hardest assignment was a 5 page paper but he graded it easy and I got a 100

The man loves history and you can tell. Works mainly with powerpoints and shows a number of videos throughout the class period to keep things interesting. A bubbly personality and tells funny stories. Tests are okay as long as you study and he always offers extra credit, one being where you create a historical meme. Few quizzes and one easy paper.

This professor is AMAZING. Not only is he passionate and intelligent, he truly cares about his students. This professor will bend over backwards for you in order to be successful. With his extra credit opportunities and clear grading criteria, failing this class would be entirely on you. History is my worst subject, but he made it very doable!

Professor Taylor is passionate about US History and his profession. He tells our nation's history to 1877 like a story, making his lectures very inspiring. He also uses video clips for visual representation of his class, which provides a little entertainment. Great professor! Highly recommended!

This professor life centers around his family first then history. He love what he does and he loves sharing it. He understands college life and will work with you. His tests are hard but if you show up for class and listen you'll at least get a b without studying. his lectures are interesting and he does not just read from a powerpoint

SUCH A NICE PROFESSOR. You can tell that he wants you to pass and doesn't want the class to be unnecessarily hard. However you definitely need to study to pass the tests given that you have to back up your answers and fill out a timeline. Gives lots of extra credit, quizzes and discussion assignments. Don't buy the book all power points are on d2l

I have never been extremely interested in history, however, Professor Taylor has so much knowledge and passion about the topic that it makes you feel passionate about it as well. The tests are composed of about 10 multiple choice questions, but you are required to back up your answers.  There is also a timeline section of the test. 10/10 recommend
